results.title: Silent Night: Story of a Christmas carol
results.brief_description: Dramatises the story of how “Silent Night” was originally written. Beginning with a wandering group pf American carollers, the story slips back to Austria in 1818. In the little town of Aberndof, Father Mohr, the vilalge priest, was struck with the beauty of Cristmas Eve and wrote a Christmas poem. His friends, Franz Gruber, the teacher-choirmaster, composed musisc for the poem and the song spread over Austria until it became a Christmas carol, popular in every corner of the globe.

results.title: Silent night with Jose Carreras
results.brief_description: During a stay in Salzburg for the Salzburg festival, Jose Carreras discovered the chapel where “Silent night” was first played by Gruber and Mohr. Produced on location in the winter-wonderland of Oberndorf, Jose Carreras is the first opera singer to present this famous Christmas carol from the original setting. He also performs other famous Christmas songs, including “White Christmas”, “Ave Maria” and “Adeste fideles”, his tenor voice creating magic for listeners of every age.

results.title: Silent night holy night
results.brief_description: Warning- there is an image drop out 30 seconds into tape, preceding the title. The church organ is in need of repair with only two days to go until Christmas. If the organ is not fixed the choir will have to sing unassisted, and the music wouldn’t sound right. The organ player makes the journey with his children to buy the part but are unable to return with it when they must abandon their car in an avalanche. As the priest reflects on the silent night in the absence of an organ, words come to him that will be familiar to everyone. An entertaining story on how one of the world most famous carols may have evolved. Featuring the beautiful voices of the Oberndorf Boys’ Choir.

results.title: Silent movie
results.creator_credit: Michael Hertzberg, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Crossbow and Mel Brooks
results.brief_description: Only one word of dialogue, (spoken by Marcel Marceau), in this Mel Brooks satire. Brooks portrays a director who comes up with a radical idea to save an ailing movie studio. He and his cronies band together to make a silent movie. Filled with slapstick gags reminiscent of the original silent classics, “Silent movie” features cameo appearances from a star studded cast including Mel Brooks, Marty Feldman, Dom DeLuise, Sid Caesar and Bernadette Peters.

results.title: Silent legacy (A)
results.creator_credit: Brian Beaton, Reel Images, NIMAA, ATSIC, ScreenWest and Debbie Gittens
results.brief_description: The filmmaker’s personal narrative of her father’s experience as one of the stolen generation and his search for identity as an adult. Harry Carmody was taken from his mother’s arms to live a white life at the Church of Christ’s Norsman Mission an event that continues to have far-reaching consequences for his family.

results.title: Silent fiction films
results.creator_credit: Williamson Kinematograph Co, BFI and National Film Archive (Australia)
results.brief_description: Four films made by the Williamson Kinemagraph Co. ‘Attack on a Chinese Mission’ (1900) an incomplete drama in which a missionary defends his family against Chinese Boxers; ‘Fire’ (1901) a drama about a house fire showing a policeman raising the alarm, a horse-drawn fire engine and various occupants being saved; ‘The Reservist before and after the War’ (1902) depicts a man receiving a summons to prepare for service in the army and his circumstances after the war; ‘An Interesting Story’ (1905) a comedy about a man so absorbed by his book that he doesn’t notice what he’s doing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Williamson Kinematograph Co, BFI and National Film Archive (Australia)

results.title: Silences of the palace = Les Silences du palais
results.creator_credit: Cinetelfilms, Magfilm, Mat Films and Moufida Tlatli
results.brief_description: This atmospheric first feature film from Tunisian director Mufida Tlatli is the story of Alia, the daughter of a beautiful servant in the palace of the last kings of Tunisia. Memories of her childhood, some pleasant, some painful, are brought to the surface when she returns to the crumbling palace that was both her home and her prison after the death of its patriarch - Sid’Ali. A sensitive, lucid portrayal of growing up in a world where women were not only in the palace to serve but were also to submit to the prince’s “rights of the bedchamber”, with luminous performances from Hend Sabri, as the young Alia, and Amel Hedhili as her overly vigilant mother, Khedija. In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: Silence speaks: digital storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Center for Digital Storytelling US and ACMI
results.brief_description: The content has been created as part of the “Silence Speaks” project, an international movement that provides the survivors of violence and abuse with an opportunity to tell their own stories. A co-production between ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling (US) to coincide with Real Life on Film. “Silence Speaks” represents the most recent examples of Australian documentary making.
